actr.model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • actr.model.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    The highest-level class representing an ACT-R model.
    Author:
    Dario Salvucci

    • Method Detail

      • compile

        public static Model compile(java.lang.String text,
                            Frame frame,
                            java.lang.String taskOverride)
        Compiles a model from a string, while also overriding the given task. The enclosing frame is also needed to provide a way to print output to the screen.
        Parameters:
        text - the model text
        frame - the enclosing frame
        taskOverride - the given task
        Returns:
        the compiled model
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • compile

        Parameters:

        frame - the enclosing frame
        Returns:

        Throws:

        Parameters:

        frame - the enclosing frame

      • hasEvent

        public boolean hasEvent(java.lang.String module)
        Checks whether there is currently an event scheduled for a particular module.
        Parameters:
        module - the module
        Returns:
        true if there is an event scheduled for the module, or false otherwise

      • hasEvent

        public boolean hasEvent(java.lang.String module,
                        java.lang.String prefix)
        Checks whether there is currently an event scheduled for a particular module with a description that starts with the given prefix.
        Parameters:
        module - the module
        prefix - the prefix string
        Returns:
        true if there is an event scheduled for the module and prefix, or false otherwise

      • changeEventTime

        public void changeEventTime(java.lang.String module,
                            java.lang.String prefix,
                            double t)
        Changes the event time for the given module with a description that starts with the given prefix.
        Parameters:
        module - the module
        prefix - the prefix string
        t - the new time

      • removeEvents

        public void removeEvents(java.lang.String module)
        Removes all events for the given module.

      • removeEvents

        public void removeEvents(java.lang.String module,
                         java.lang.String prefix)
        Removes all events for the given module with a description that starts with the given prefix.
        Parameters:
        module - the module
        prefix - the prefix string

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs a model simulation until there are no more events on the event queue, or until stop() is explicitly called.

      • run

        public void run(boolean reset)
        Run a model simulation until there are no more events on the event queue, or until stop() is called.
        Parameters:
        reset - true to start the model from time zero, or false to resume from the current state

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Terminates the simulation of the model (potentially before its completion).

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the simulation of the model (equivalent to run(false)).

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Checks whether the model simulation has completed (i.e., there are no more events in the event queue).
        Returns:
        true if the model has completed, or false otherwise

      • isVerbose

        public boolean isVerbose()
        Checks whether the model verbose trace is on.
        Returns:
        true if verbose trace is on, or false otherwise

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(java.lang.String parameter,
                         java.lang.String value)
        Sets a global ACT-R parameter (equivalent to (sgp \ \) in the model code).
        Parameters:
        parameter - the parameter to set, specified as a String and beginning with ':'

      • runCommand

        public void runCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
        Compiles and runs an ACT-R command specified as a string (e.g., (add-dm (goal isa task))).
        Parameters:
        cmd - the command specified as a string
